channel.title: [PI] Help
channel.description: How can I make it so someone is protected from all commands, like ::ban, ::ipban, ::demote, etc.

item.title: [PI] Help
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I, post:6, topic:406873”]You’re parsing a substring and splitting the arguments.

if(Server.playerHandler.players[1].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) {I don’t even know what you’re doing this for.

Connection.addNameToBanList(playerToBan);You don’t need the substring when the arguments were split already.

Just to save time;

[code=Java]if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“ban”)) {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
String user = “”;
try {
for (int i = 1; i < args.length; i++)
user = args[i] + " ";
for (Player p : PlayerHandler.players) {
if (p != null) {
if (p.properName.equalsIgnoreCase(user.trim())) {
if (!p.properName.equalsIgnoreCase(“OWNER”)) {
final Client cl = (Client)p;

                    //This is the TODO:
                    Connection.addNameToBanList(cl.properName);
                    Connection.addNameToFile(cl.properName);
                } else {
                    c.sendMessage("You cannot " + playerCommand + " the owner!");
                    return;
                }
            }
        } else
            return;
    }
} catch (Exception e) {
    e.printStackTrace();
}

}[/code][/quote]
thank you very much for the lesson

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Help
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Could you tell me which parts I messed up on, or what is bad about it, so I can learn. Don’t spoonfeed me the whole command though, I need to learn to do it myself.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Help
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I, post:4, topic:406873”]You can’t add parts of the command.

Will you please fucking read?

DELETE YOUR ‘PUNISHING’ COMMANDS. ADD MY ‘TEMPLATE’ COMMAND. EDIT THE NAME. EDIT THE //TODO:[/quote]
I just did this… is it that bad?

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("ban")) { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(4); String[] args = playerCommand.split(" "); String user = ""; try { for (int i = 1; i < args.length; i++) user = args[i] + " "; for (Player p : PlayerHandler.players) { if (p != null) { if (p.properName.equalsIgnoreCase(user.trim())) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[1].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) { if (!p.properName.equalsIgnoreCase("OWNER")) { final Client cl = (Client)p; Connection.addNameToBanList(playerToBan); Connection.addNameToFile(playerToBan); } else { c.sendMessage("You cannot " + playerCommand + " the owner!"); return; } } } } else return; } } catch (Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); } }

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Help
item.dc:creator: @Nonamee Nonamee
item.description:
@Nonamee wrote:

I tried adding parts of the ban command to his and I got this error:

[code]src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:460: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable user
location: class server.model.players.packets.Commands
if (p.properName.equalsIgnoreCase(user.trim()))
{
^
Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
1 error
Press any key to continue . . .

[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Help
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“Nonamee, post:8, topic:406855”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=503844.msg3686549#msg3686549 date=1311886307]
No. You would study the code and learn how to use it. Obviously that is only a general structure for the command. (Any command which only takes one argument, actually.)
[/quote]

Ugh, I can’t figure out where to put it. Wherever I put it, I get errors. I only put part of it. Can you tell me where to put what for this command?

if (playerCommand.startsWith("ban") && playerCommand.charAt(3) == ' ') { try { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(4); Connection.addNameToBanList(playerToBan); Connection.addNameToFile(playerToBan); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) { Server.playerHandler.players[i].disconnected = true; } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } }[/quote]
You have to add parts of the ban command in his command.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Help
item.dc:creator: @Nonamee Nonamee
item.description:
@Nonamee wrote:

No. You would study the code and learn how to use it. Obviously that is only a general structure for the command. (Any command which only takes one argument, actually.)

Ugh, I can’t figure out where to put it. Wherever I put it, I get errors. I only put part of it. Can you tell me where to put what for this command?

if (playerCommand.startsWith("ban") && playerCommand.charAt(3) == ' ') { try { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(4); Connection.addNameToBanList(playerToBan); Connection.addNameToFile(playerToBan); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) { Server.playerHandler.players[i].disconnected = true; } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } }

item.title: [PI] Help
item.dc:creator: @Nonamee Nonamee
item.description:
@Nonamee wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I, post:1, topic:406873”]if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("command name")) { String[] args = playerCommand.split(" "); String user = ""; try { for (int i = 1; i < args.length; i++) user = args[i] + " "; for (Player p : PlayerHandler.players) { if (p != null) { if (p.properName.equalsIgnoreCase(user.trim())) { if (!p.properName.equalsIgnoreCase("OWNER")) { final Client cl = (Client)p; //TODO: Punishments (mutes, bans, etc.) } else { c.sendMessage("You cannot " + playerCommand + " the owner!"); return; } } } else return; } } catch (Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); } }You may use this syntax for mutes, bans, etc.[/quote]

I’d add that whole thing under a command like mute/ban or something?
